alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Washington; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:53AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Heavy rainfall with minor flooding will impact portions of west central Bristol, northeastern Washington, Kent, central Providence and northwestern Bristol Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1052 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Greenwich, or near Coventry, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding possible for the Providence metro. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, South Kingstown, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, North Kingstown, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Barrington and Swansea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
